meanings.definition: A bridge or section of road that crosses over another road or body of water without intersecting with it.
meanings.sent1: The cars drove under the flyover to reach the other side of the river.
meanings.sent2: The highway had a flyover that allowed traffic to pass over the busy intersection.
meanings.sent3: The flyover looked like a giant metal rainbow stretching across the highway.
meanings.sent4: The flyover was a lifeline for commuters, saving them from long detours.
meanings.sent5: The flyover's shadow provided a cool spot for picnickers on hot summer days.

meanings.sent1: The pilot completed a flyover of the city before heading back to the airport.
meanings.sent2: During the airshow, the planes performed a spectacular flyover above the crowd.
meanings.sent3: The flyover was so smooth that the passengers didn't spill a drop of their drinks.
meanings.sent4: The flyover gave the passengers a bird's eye view of the landscape below.
meanings.sent5: The flyover left a trail of white clouds in the clear blue sky.

meanings.definition: A type of aerial maneuver in which an aircraft flies over a specified area.
meanings.sent1: The military jets executed a precise flyover during the national anthem.
meanings.sent2: The flyover showcased the agility and speed of the fighter planes.
meanings.sent3: The flyover startled the birds perched on the nearby trees.
meanings.sent4: The flyover was a breathtaking display of aviation skills.
meanings.sent5: The flyover left the spectators in awe of the pilots' expertise.
